functions.name: get_terragrunt_dir
functions.description:
Gets the directory containing the Terragrunt configuration file.

* Returns the absolute path to the directory containing the Terragrunt configuration.
* Useful for constructing paths relative to the Terragrunt configuration file.

returnType.description: Absolute path to the Terragrunt configuration directory

functions.name: get_terraform_commands_that_need_vars
functions.description:
Gets the list of Terraform commands that accept input variables.

* Returns a list of Terraform commands that can use input variables.
* Useful for conditionally applying variable files.

returnType.description: List of Terraform commands that accept variables

functions.name: get_terraform_commands_that_need_locking
functions.description:
Gets the list of Terraform commands that use state locking.

* Returns a list of Terraform commands that use state locking.
* Useful for managing state lock behavior.

returnType.description: List of Terraform commands that use state locking

functions.name: run_cmd
functions.description:
Executes a shell command and returns its output.

* Runs the specified command and returns its stdout as a string.
* Useful for incorporating external script outputs into your configuration.

parameters.name: command
parameters.description: Command to execute

functions.name: sops_decrypt_file
functions.description:
Decrypts a file encrypted with SOPS.

* Decrypts the specified file using SOPS and returns its contents.
* Useful for managing encrypted configuration files.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to the encrypted file

functions.name: read_terragrunt_config
functions.description:
Reads and parses a Terragrunt configuration file.

* Reads the specified Terragrunt configuration file and returns its contents.
* Useful for sharing configuration between different Terragrunt files.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to the Terragrunt configuration file

parameters.name: default_value
parameters.description: Default value to return if the file doesn't exist

functions.name: get_terraform_command
functions.description:
Gets the current Terraform command being executed.

* Returns the name of the Terraform command that Terragrunt is running.
* Useful for conditional logic based on the command being run.

functions.name: get_terraform_cli_args
functions.description:
Gets the command line arguments passed to Terraform.

* Returns the list of arguments that will be passed to Terraform.
* Useful for inspecting or modifying Terraform command arguments.

functions.name: get_env
functions.description:
Retrieves environment variables with an optional default value.

* Returns the value of the environment variable or the default value if not set.
* Useful for incorporating environment-specific values into your Terragrunt configurations.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the environment variable to retrieve

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: The default value to return if the environment variable is not set

returnType.description: Value of the environment variable or default value

functions.name: get_platform
functions.description:
Gets the current operating system platform.

* Returns the current operating system platform (e.g., 'windows', 'darwin', 'linux').
* Useful for platform-specific configurations.

functions.name: get_repo_root
functions.description:
Gets the root directory of the Git repository.

* Returns the absolute path to the root of the current Git repository.
* Useful for referencing files relative to the repository root.

returnType.description: Absolute path to Git repository root

functions.name: regex_replace
functions.description:
Performs regular expression replacement on a string.

* Replaces all matches of a regular expression with a replacement string.
* Useful for string manipulation and formatting.

parameters.name: string
parameters.description: The input string to perform replacement on

parameters.name: pattern
parameters.description: The regular expression pattern to match

parameters.name: replacement
parameters.description: The string to replace matches with

functions.name: yamldecode
functions.description:
Decodes a YAML string into a value.

* Parses a YAML-formatted string and returns the resulting value.
* Useful for reading YAML configuration files.

parameters.name: yaml
parameters.description: The YAML string to decode

functions.name: yamlencode
functions.description:
Encodes a value as a YAML string.

* Converts a value into a YAML-formatted string.
* Useful for generating YAML configuration files.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to encode as YAML

functions.name: jsondecode
functions.description:
Decodes a JSON string into a value.

* Parses a JSON-formatted string and returns the resulting value.
* Useful for reading JSON configuration files.

parameters.name: json
parameters.description: The JSON string to decode

functions.name: jsonencode
functions.description:
Encodes a value as a JSON string.

* Converts a value into a JSON-formatted string.
* Useful for generating JSON configuration files.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to encode as JSON

functions.name: read_tfvars_file
functions.description:
Reads and parses a tfvars file.

* Reads the contents of a .tfvars file and returns the parsed variables.
* Useful for incorporating existing Terraform variable files.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to the .tfvars file

functions.name: get_terraform_commands_that_need_retry
functions.description:
Gets Terraform commands that should be retried on certain errors.

* Returns a list of Terraform commands that should be retried if they fail with certain errors.
* Useful for handling transient failures.

returnType.description: List of Terraform commands that support retry

functions.name: get_path_from_repo_root
functions.description:
Gets the path relative to the repository root.

* Returns the relative path from the repository root to the current configuration.
* Useful for generating paths based on repository structure.

functions.name: get_path_to_repo_root
functions.description:
Gets the path to the repository root.

* Returns the relative path from the current configuration to the repository root.
* Useful for referencing files at the repository root.

functions.name: basename
functions.description:
Gets the last element of a path.

* Returns the last element of a file path or URL.
* Useful for extracting filenames or final path components.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to extract the basename from

functions.name: dirname
functions.description:
Gets all but the last element of a path.

* Returns the directory path containing the specified path.
* Useful for getting parent directories.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The path to extract the directory from

functions.name: merge
functions.description:
Merges multiple maps into a single map.

* Combines multiple maps into a single map, with later values taking precedence.
* Useful for combining multiple configuration objects.

parameters.name: maps
parameters.description: Two or more maps to merge

functions.name: coalesce
functions.description:
Returns the first non-null value from a list of values.

* Takes multiple arguments and returns the first non-null value.
* Useful for providing fallback values.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: List of values to check

functions.name: find_in_parent_folders
functions.description:
Searches up the directory tree from the current terragrunt.hcl file and returns the absolute path to the first file or folder with a given name.

* Returns the path to the first matching file found in a parent folder.
* If no file is found, throws an error unless a fallback is provided.
* Can be used to find both files and folders.
* Searches relative to the child terragrunt.hcl config when called from a parent config.

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: Name of the file or folder to find (defaults to terragrunt.hcl)

parameters.name: fallback
parameters.description: Fallback value if the file is not found

returnType.description: Path to the found file/folder or fallback value

functions.name: path_relative_to_include
functions.description:
Returns the relative path between the current terragrunt.hcl file and the path specified in its include block.

* Returns the relative path from the including configuration to the current configuration.
* Useful for generating unique identifiers or paths based on directory structure.
* If multiple include blocks exist, requires a name parameter to specify which include block to base the relative path on.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the include block to base the relative path on (required if multiple include blocks exist)

functions.name: get_parent_terragrunt_dir
functions.description:
Gets the directory containing the parent Terragrunt configuration file.

* Returns the absolute path to the directory containing the parent Terragrunt configuration.
* Useful for referencing files relative to the parent configuration.
* For configurations with multiple include blocks, requires a name parameter to specify which include block to use as the parent.
* Returns the root instead of the leaf of your terragrunt configurations.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the include block to base the parent directory on (required if multiple include blocks exist)

returnType.description: Absolute path to the parent Terragrunt configuration directory

functions.name: get_original_terragrunt_dir
functions.description:
Returns the directory where the original Terragrunt configuration file lives. This is primarily useful when one Terragrunt config is being read from another.

* Returns the absolute path to where the original terragrunt.hcl file lives.
* Useful when one Terragrunt config is being read from another config file.

returnType.description: Absolute path to original Terragrunt configuration directory

functions.name: get_terraform_commands_that_need_input
functions.description:
Gets the list of Terraform commands that accept the -input parameter.

* Returns a list of Terraform commands that accept the -input=(true or false) parameter.
* Useful for configuring commands that should run non-interactively.

returnType.description: List of Terraform commands that accept -input parameter

functions.name: get_terraform_commands_that_need_parallelism
functions.description:
Gets the list of Terraform commands that accept the -parallelism parameter.

* Returns a list of Terraform commands that can have their parallelism modified.
* Useful for controlling resource creation parallelism.

returnType.description: List of Terraform commands that accept -parallelism parameter

functions.name: get_aws_account_alias
functions.description:
Returns the AWS account alias associated with the current credentials.

* Returns the alias of the current AWS account.
* Returns empty string if alias cannot be found.
* Value can change during parsing of HCL code.

returnType.description: AWS account alias or empty string

functions.name: get_aws_account_id
functions.description:
Returns the AWS account ID associated with the current credentials.

* Returns the ID of the current AWS account.
* Value can change during parsing of HCL code, for example after evaluation of iam_role attribute.

functions.name: get_aws_caller_identity_arn
functions.description:
Returns the ARN of the AWS identity associated with the current credentials.

* Returns the ARN of the current AWS identity.
* Value can change during parsing of HCL code, for example after evaluation of iam_role attribute.

functions.name: get_aws_caller_identity_user_id
functions.description:
Returns the UserId of the AWS identity associated with the current credentials.

* Returns the UserId of the current AWS identity.
* Value can change during parsing of HCL code, for example after evaluation of iam_role attribute.

functions.name: get_working_dir
functions.description:
Returns the absolute path where Terragrunt runs Terraform commands.

* Returns the absolute path to the working directory.
* Useful when you need to manage substitutions of vars inside a *.tfvars file located in terragrunt's tmp dir.

functions.name: mark_as_read
functions.description:
Marks a file as read for inclusion by the queue-include-units-reading flag.

* Marks the specified file as being read by the configuration.
* Useful for situations when you want to mark a file as read but are not reading it using a native Terragrunt HCL function.

parameters.name: file_path
parameters.description: Path to the file to mark as read

functions.name: get_default_retryable_errors
functions.description:
Returns the list of default retryable errors.

* Returns a list of error patterns that Terragrunt will retry by default.
* Useful for extending the default retry behavior.

returnType.description: List of default retryable error patterns

functions.name: get_terragrunt_source_cli_flag
functions.description:
Returns the value passed via --terragrunt-source flag or TERRAGRUNT_SOURCE environment variable.

* Returns the source override value if specified.
* Returns empty string if neither the flag nor environment variable is set.
* Useful for constructing hooks or flags that only apply to local development.

returnType.description: Source override value or empty string

functions.name: path_relative_from_include
functions.description:
Returns the relative path between the path specified in its include block and the current terragrunt.hcl file.

* Counterpart to path_relative_to_include().
* Useful for constructing relative paths from included configurations.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the include block to base the relative path on (required if multiple include blocks exist)

returnType.description: Relative path from include to current configuration

functions.name: get_terraform_commands_that_need_vars
functions.description:
Gets the list of Terraform commands that accept -var and -var-file parameters.

* Returns a list of Terraform commands that can use input variables.
* Useful for conditionally applying variable files.

returnType.description: List of Terraform commands that accept variables
